sentences.sContent: At the end of each level, there’s an exam.
sentences.sCn: 在每一级别结束时都有一次考试。

sentences.sContent: How did you do in your exams?
...It seems to me that a compromise would be receiving the exam questions a day or two in advance...
...Most professors agree whether to give an in-class or a take-home exam depends on type of course being taught...
...125 students at Harvard were caught up in a scandal when it was discovered they had cheated on a take-home exam for a class entitled ―Introduction To Congress...
...How should students prepare for an exam according to the speaker...
...Have you taken Professor Young’s exam before...

trans.tranOther: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one
